turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about The Islanders (TV series).
turn.2: The Islanders (TV series) The Islanders is an American adventure television series which aired on ABC from 1960 to 1961, starring William Reynolds, James Philbrook, and Diane Brewster.
turn.4: Stated a UPI article on 20 September 1960, “Basis of the show is a one-airplane airline run by the three principals in the lush East Indies.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: The men are soldiers of fortune and Diane [Brewster] plays a Dutch girl attempting to regain her family’s property.” At the beginning of the series, Sandy Wade (Reynolds) and Zack Malloy (Philbrook), co-owners of a Grumman Goose amphibious aircraft, start their one-plane airline in the Moluccas or Spice Islands of the southeastern Pacific Ocean.
turn.7: Is there anything else about the article you can share?
turn.8: Throughout the series they experience a variety of adventures where seemingly harmless charter flights put them into danger.
turn.9: Did they have any other characters on the show?
turn.10: They are frequently aided in their endeavours by the unusually-named Wilhelmina ”Steamboat Willy” Vanderveer (Brewster) and Shipwreck Callighan (Roy Wright).
turn.11: What other things can you tell me about the show?
turn.12: "The boys get into lots of messes," said Brewster "and things aren't helped for them by the way I play one of them against the other in whatever romantic notions they have about me." William Reynolds stated in an interview, "The series went from being sort of like a "Terry and the Pirates" or a "Maverick" type of concept to becoming just a bunch of people skulking around.
